title: Best in the Market & Great Developer
comment: Does what it says without problems. Most of its bugs I experienced in its earlier days have been fixed, and new features are continually being implemented. The developer  pays great attention to user feedback and bug reports. Definitely deserves a better rating than the current 3.8.

title: Stupid app
comment: Make your handy lagging!

title: It works but need lots of improvement
comment: The app doesn't protect itself. Anyone who open the app can easy change ur lock screen password.

title: Seems to work well on HTC One M8 with Lollipop
comment: In difference to the stock Smart Lock functionality on Lollipop, this app actually seems to work flawlessly! And usability is much better as well. I was surprised to see it work so well on my device, after reading it's still in beta.  There are some features I'd like to see in this app additionally: - A setting to show user-defined text (owner info) on the lock screen; - Show next alarm time, similar to stock lock screens; - Maybe a feature to bypass the lock screen if the phone is connected to one of specific WiFi access points.  Good thing, the app is open source, so maybe I'll implement some of these features myself and will send a patch to the author for consideration.
So very very glitchy provides no security after first unlocking glitches and locks up some menus

Hi, The app is still in beta so glitches and bugs are expected from time to time. We are currently rethinking and reimplementing major parts of the app. Multiple new features and fixes are planned for the next big official out-of-beta release coming up very soon. If you have the time, could you please report the glithes/bugs you found in an email?

title: Pretty good
comment: Please, please add 12-hr clock and owner info on lockscreen.
Hi Kevin, Thank you for your review! We are currently working on those features and they will be available on the next update. All the best!

title: Works very well
comment: The only thing that I found lacking was being able to choose the background image on the lock screen. I will probably donate so that can be resolved.
Hi Aaron! We are currently working on a fresh remake with Material Design, new features and customisation. Hopefully you guys will like it! All the best.

title: Nice
comment: I use this with my college ID so I can unlock my phone to read my notifications without actually touching my phone, which is handy in class! I had a few issues setting it up but it appears to work fine now :)
Would like it more if it did not engage during calls,  just allowed screen off,  then awoke without locking.

title: Works, minor bugs.
comment: I'm quite impressed, but there's a minor bugs. First I had to click on what lock screen I wanted to use multiple times even after selecting [always] same thing with my home button. This did disappeared withing a couple of minutes of usage, but I was really close to uninstalling. Great overall!

title: Seamless.
comment: I love it. Works well on my Note 3, and when I contacted the creator for an issue on my HTC, I got a quick response. Thoroughly impressed with the app, and the creator.

Hi Kei, Thank you very much for your review and the amazing suggestions from the emails! We really appreciate it! We hope you will like the new features, improvements and fixes we have in plan to release very soon :) All the best!

title: Suggestions (Disable during call)
comment: Thanks for making this, but could you please disable it during an active call? Would be nice if users could customize timeout settings. Also, do you really need all those permissions? Maybe a lite version with no camera etc...

Hi Jonathan, The lockscreen should go to the back while the user is in a call. We will definitely investigate that issue on the Galaxy S4 and fix it as soon as possible. About the timeout, we are currently working on implementing that. The camera permission in the app is being used for the flashlight button in the toolbox only. All the best!

title: Good but...
comment: Add screen timeout options,  closes way too fast. Perhaps an option to prevent lock for a set period. Works well otherwise.
Hi Darren, We are currently working on implementing the suggestions you made. Thank you for your review! All the best!

title: Good just need to add a bit
comment: Just need to add the app locker to..Just a tap we can unlock app like whatsapp and wechat

title: Good but..
comment: Works fine for unlock but seems to open phone, contacts etc randomly. Also needs a 12 hour clock and a way to hide the pin input like the flashlight etc. Other than a few slight issues fantastic app

title: Bad situation
comment: Had to soft reset phone after failing to recognize implant arbitrarily

title: Not a bad idea 💡
comment: This is a nice way to use NFC but a more handsome and personisable lockscreen would be great! :)
Hi Antoine, Thank you for your review! Design improvements and extra functionality update is coming soon!

title: Best aap
comment: Nfc unlock 😎
Slow to unlock both ways

title: It's good.
comment: I would like to be able hide the keypad and just use my NFC implant, maybe have the keypad option alongside the flash light.

title: Material design?
comment: Em.... that design, a bit boring already.... maybe allow user to customize theme? Extra feature=extra coding 😄😄😄

Hi Henry, that bug has been fixed with the new 2.0.x beta update releases, which feature a UI and functionality redesign, lots of new features, speed/stability/security improvements and many other bug fixes!
Screen is locked while you talking phone. It is not ok, when you need enter extension phone, tap menu numbers etc.

title: I loved it but... (LOVE IT)
comment: It doesn't work on Lollipop. EDIT: Figured it out. Have to disable screen lock.
Hi Jason, Thank you for your review! We will introduce a view slider for the lockscreen toolbox on the next major update so it won't be visible only if the user wants it to.

title: Works great
comment: This so works as it's supposed to, but needs a 12 hour clock and more unlock methods.

title: Amazing!
comment: Works exactly as it is supposed to!

Hi Wesley! Thank you very much for your review! We really appreciate it! A new app update should be available in a few hours which features a rebuilt lockscreen toolbox, Android 5.0 support and many other fixes/improvements. All the best!

title: Is not adding tag
comment: After reinstall It did add tags again
Hi Menno! Thank you for your review! The adding tags bug has been fixed in the new version update which should be available in a few hours. All the best!

title: Google now from lock screen
comment: This is pretty good, way better than the old one. Can you integrate Google now and the camera app into the lock screen?
Hi Chris, Thank you for your review! We are working on integrating camera functionality into the app on the next update together with many other features/improvements. All the best!

title: Premise is great, MAJOR bug
comment: This is one of the few apps that has such a great premise that it alone bumped up a one-star review. First of all, shout out to you for the great idea!  But the most important functionality is not working on my phone. When I click the plus and scan the tag, the scan dialog goes away (like it probably should), but then it just opens the main screen again, with no new options, no new tags, and nothing to name my tag. Again, if this issue was resolved, that alone would necessitate a five star review on my part
Hi Devin, Thank you for your review! We are currently working on fixing that bug and we will release a new update containing new features, improvements and numerous fixes! All the best!

title: Great app!
comment: It would be better if the alternate way to unlock is by pattern, pin or nfc. Also when accessing the app, it'll be better to have a lock so it'll be more secure and no one can disable the the lock.

title: Lock timer and dimmer
comment: On my Samsung I have the option of my screen turning off before the screen is locked, on different timers which your app doesn't have. This is great if I quickly want to use my phone again because even if my phone appears locked it isn't, it's also saving power and your app would benift from this type of function so people can personalise the lock screen timeout.

title: Useful
comment: Installed yesterday, seemed great way to unlock phone easily. Today though alarm went off and instead of it being over lock screen as usual I couldn't turn alarm off until unlocked. That's the wrong way round, great if it could be fixed.
Hi Peter, Thank you for your review! We are addressing that problem on the next update. All the best!

title: Anyway that ...
comment: ... you can add lock screen widgets to this? That would make it perfect

title: NFC = No flipping good
comment: Key pad does not work on wake up and nfc tag is somewhere I am now  stuffed, as soon as I can I will uninstall!!

title: Great app, needs more features
comment: I love this app. I can unlock my phone using the NFC tag in my pocket and wow all my iPhone friends. It also solved the problem of having to change my pin all the time from people discovering it. However, this app could use some new features. For one the toolbox would be more useful if it could be hidden and the options inside made changeable. Also, while the iOS styling is nice and all, a theme selection would be nice too, maybe in a paid version?

Best nfc unlock app i've found but has 4 major problems that keeps me from using it continuously.  First, there seems to be a bug where about 30% of the time after unlock, the pull down notification bar is still locked until I open an app and hit home.  Second, there is no emergency phone option or ICE info. Third, it constantly has a notification in the notification bar that says it's active. I wish it could be turned off. Last, there is no timeout option before lock. Would pay if fixed. Thanks!
Hi Ben, Thank you very much for your review! We are currently working on those issues and we will address them on the upcoming update. All the best!

title: Better than the nfc ring app
comment: I have just received my nfc ring and was underwhelmed by the software. This app works and looks a lot better atm.
Hi Andrew, Thank you very much for your review! We are working on improving the app significantly in the following months with amazing new features and fixes. All the best!

title: Pretty good
comment: Setup is straight forward and simple. The unlock screen is laid out nicely.  The main issue is that the lock screen comes on several seconds after the home screen when restarting the device. Which leaves the device unprotected. Maybe that can bee addressed in future updates.

title: Android L and ART
comment: doesn't work properly on ART or Android L (tried on 4.4.4 on ART and Android L) hope these two will be supported soon. I can see promising future for this app. thanks guys!
Hi Kim, Thank you for your review! We will add full support for Android L once it officially releases.

title: its work
comment: i like it
Big improvement, phone can no longer power off from buttons being hit in my pocket!  The volume still gets changed, but that's not as frustrating.

Hi Kate, I tested the new update on multiple devices (including the nexus 5) and the NFC unlocking works perfectly. Make sure you have NFC enabled. The soft buttons at the bottom of the screen are all disabled if you chose the 'NFC Lockscreen' as your default launcher. 'Power off' dialog dismiss has been introduced in v2.0.7, coming out today.

title: Entirely Broken after update
comment: [Edit] uninstalled and reinstalled and it works again, sadly had to import my tags again.[/Edit]                   I have a stock nexus 5 and after the update this app is entirely broken. It was semi functioning before but now this is unusable.

title: Brilliant
comment: You have done a good job. And sometimes, the lock screen didn't show up.

title: Getting better
comment: This is working better than previous version. But I still have some issues with it. It seems to lock everytime my screen times out (I had my phone set up to only lock after 30 minutes unless I locked it manually). A minor thing I can live with though. Of more concern is the fact it still won't work with an encrypted phone - at least it won't replace the encryption challenge. While the NFC key may be fairly secure, a 4 digit pin isn't very secure. Would prefer to use a strong password at least for backup access when NFC tag is unavailable, especially since I have to decrypt my phone now. Also would be nice if notification screen didn't constantly display app as active. It's just burning notification real-estate

Hi David, future updates will feature a password/pattern unlock which will enforce the security of the lockscreen. The notification is a security requirement for the lockscreen service (I've set the priority of the notification to minimum so it shouldn't show up in the collapsed notification bar and it will always appear as the last notification).

title: Won't uninstall
comment: Tried everything to uninstall this app.  Phone reboots when I try to uninstall the app.  Not good.  Please fix.
Hi Alan, we just released version 2.0.5 which fixed the uninstall bug. All the best!

title: Love it
comment: Works like a bomb when scanning nfc tag but If I tap on the pin access it just unlocks without asking pin.

Hi Will, That bug has been fixed with the new 2.0.x beta update releases, which feature a UI and functionality redesign, lots of new features, speed/stability/security improvements and many other bug fixes!

title: Do not install
comment: Phone can unlock without NFC. This is not secure at all. Now I want to uninstall but it won't allow me to.

Hi Chris, Sorry for the inconvenience! The unlocking bug has been fixed with the new 2.0.x beta update releases, which feature a UI and functionality redesign, lots of new features, speed/stability/security improvements and many other bug fixes! The uninstall instructions for 1.0 and 1.1 versions have been posted in the app description.

title: Insecure!
comment: Clicking PIN entry on the Unlock Screen sometimes skips the ACTUAL PIN entry and takes you straight into the handset. I was impressed until this happened on more than one occasion. I'm running KK 4.4.4. If this is fixed, I'll review my comments but right now I am seriously unimpressed. Very dangerous, and NOT recommended.

Hi Jonny, Thank you for the constructive review! The bug has been fixed with the new 2.0.x beta update releases, which feature a UI and functionality redesign, lots of new features, speed/stability/security improvements and many other bug fixes!
How do I Uninstaller this app?

Hi Arthur, If you have version 1.0 to 1.1 installed, go to Settings > Security > Device administrators and uncheck TapUnlock; you can then uninstall normally. If you have updated to 2.0.x series which came out yesterday, you can uninstall normally, without going into Device administrators.

title: It does as advertised
comment: If it had more customizable options I would give it a five star. It only unlocks the phone. Bad part is I can't disabled it or uninstall it.

Hi Andrew! We have fixed most of the issues regarding uninstalling or disabling with the new 2.0.x beta update releases, which feature a UI and functionality redesign, lots of new features, speed/stability/security improvements and many other bug fixes!

title: Flaky
comment: Screen flicker and menu pull down

Hi Tim, Thank you for your review! The screen flicker and menu pull down have been fixed with the new 2.0.x beta update releases, which feature a UI and functionality redesign, lots of new features, speed/stability/security improvements and many other bug fixes!

title: Help
comment: How do I uninstal?

Hi Dan! To uninstall, go to Settings - Security - Device administrators and uncheck TapUnlock; you can then uninstall the normal way. The administrator permission is required for screen unlock and lock (we will remove it and introduce a new approach on the next version, coming up very soon). Sorry for any inconvenience caused!
Problematic on note 3

Hi Sujeet, the problems on note3 have been fixed with the new 2.0.x beta update releases, which feature a UI and functionality redesign, lots of new features, speed/stability/security improvements and many other bug fixes!

title: Thankyou
comment: Cool,work's great thankyou.

title: Good idea, but needs work.
comment: I love the idea of unlocking using my NFC enabled wrist band.. however with TapUnlock as the default lock screen, when I get a missed call the screen stays on until I turn it off. This is extremely exhausting on battery. So I have had to stop using it. Will keep an eye out for a fix though, as I really like the idea.
Hi Chris! Thank you for your review. We have addressed the power consumption issues together with many other fixes and a redesign on the next update, available very soon.

title: WTF???
comment: Not only did half disable my facelock - when I press the cross on the stock facelock it unlocked my phone straight away - but it doesn't actually do anything at all, messed my phone up bad... My other stock lockscreens appear randomly too - and I mean ALL OF THEM not just one kind, first the swipe lock, then my facelock, then swipe lock again and now pattern, how the Hell is that even possible???

Hi! It is recommended to disable any other active lock screens like the face, swipe or 3rd party before enabling the NFC lock screen to prevent any functionality bugs (the app is still in beta). We are sorry for the inconvenience caused! We are working on it! Thank you for the feedback.

title: Nice App :)
comment: Using the app on HTC One M8 with NFC ring/NFC Keychain. Works well without having the root access on device (really thanks for that). But, the NFC tag unlock screen blocks the useful lock screen features. It'd be better to see the lock screen with time/date/weather widget and lock screen apps/notifications, like it's seen on pin access screen. Also, live wallpaper is not supported on NFC tag unlock screen as it's on pin access screen. Few issues noted so far, 1) some time when the device is restarted it asks to set the default launcher again. 2)  if try to launch an app directly from lock screen (pin access lock screen) it asks for the pin twice.
Thank you for your review! We are slowly introducing new design features, functionality improvements and bug fixes as time progresses, many of them coming up on the next update. All the best!

title: It works
comment: This is great using it with a Sony smartband. Only annoying thing is the nfc sound every time I unlock don't think that's this just a general issue any way of disabling that sound?
The sound is made by the Android NFC Service when a tag is detected. We will fix that on the next update. Thank you very much for your review! All the best

title: Slightly bugged?
comment: I'm getting used to an NFC ring I recently received, and my phone is a bit finicky, so I really want to be able to unlock my phone via pin and/or NFC. However when I set the pin and try to use it, it keeps telling me incorrect pin, so I need to get the NFC to work. Eventually I hope to get used to using NFC for the most part, but I still need the pin to work too. Currently have it disabled for fear of losing access to my phone, but hoping for a fix that will let me re-enable.
Hi Brian! Thank you for your review. We have many fixes and improvements coming up very soon. All the best!

title: Does the job
comment: Works well.

title: Awesome app but still not there
comment: The Good: Easy to install, smooth unlock when getting a good read from NFC tag.  The Bad: Sometimes the NFC connection sound is heard but the screen is not unlocked, therefore you need to look at the phone when you unlock it to make sure it actually unlocks. I have had bad experience with that when you need quick access and you end up scanning four times before it actually unlocks. Usually I end up using the "PIN access" button but it needs to shut down the screen and back up going through this nice cathodic tube animation before I can actually input my PIN. This is the single most annoying thing for this app and made me deactivate it. I would love to have the PIN input straight on the first window.  Overall, the concept of the app is brilliant, I would love to use it again but as of now, it seems to be a little unreliable.
Hi Daniel! Thank you for your review! A lot of fixes and improvements are coming up on the next update. We are currently addressing many more.

title: One of the few apps I would take the time to review!
comment: Its a great app built on a simple concept it works great and there isn't any restrictions!  PS. If you add a persistent notification it will stop the app from closing and unsevurin gthme device!
Hi Callum! Thank you very much for your review! We will address that on our next update.
Change stupid 4-digit limit for PIN to at least 6

Hi Anton! A 4-digit PIN is convenient and easy to remember. A 6-digit PIN doesn't provide any additional security since the PINs cannot be bruteforced on un-rooted devices with USB debugging disabled.

title: Glad there was an app for what I wanted :)
comment: Simple and nice, like the lack of ads too! Using the Xperia Z1 it doesn't seem to be keeping the app running and doesn't always ask for the NFC tag. A fix would be good only thing I could ask for guys is a clock instead of the lock when I wake up my phone.
Hi Dillon! Thank you very much for your review. We will add a clock/notifications feature very soon. All the best.

title: So annoying
comment: I have never rated an app like this, but this really bothered me.  It replaces your default unlock and if the tag's not around all the time, you gotta take some extra steps to unlock your phone. After that, it just unlocks the phone without asking the password! It also keeps turning the screen on and asking to scan the tag.  I had trouble removing this app and turning everything back to the way it was.

Hi Mehran, most of those bugs have been fixed with the new 2.0.x beta update releases, which feature a UI and functionality redesign, lots of new features, speed/stability/security improvements and many other bug fixes!

title: Security Flaw on nexus 5
comment: Turn on screen Swipe down from top. Go into setting (Takes a few tries since on a tap it will turn off the screen) Goto apps Goto downloaded Goto tapunlock Click clear defaults Press home Select a launcher other than tap unlock We're now at the home screen without using NFC or entering a pin. Please patch this. Otherwise it works excellent.
Hi Jud! We are aware of that issue and we will address it. It's only an issue for the nexus 5 and very high end devices; the OS loads the UI for the status bar quicker than the app's lock feature.

title: It's a great app
comment: but sometimes, when I hit pin unlock or tap my home, back, and app switcher buttons the whole thing deactivates. You might want to fix that soon.

Hi Keith! Thank you for informing us about the bug. We will address it as soon as possible. Our main objective was to make this work perfectly on all devices (rooted and unrooted), but it's becoming quite difficult because each device responds differently to each feature.

title: Great App!
comment: I love being able to use an NFC tag on my key chain to unlock my phone. The two issues I am having so far is my screen immediately comes back on after pressing the lock button (essentially making me have to hit the button twice to make it go to sleep mode), could you by chance fix that? Also, when I try to swipe down to bring my notifications up so I can see what they are, the app will not let me. Can you also fix this in the future?

Hi Harvy! Thank you for the review and thank you for reporting the power button bug, we will address it in the next update. The lockscreen doesn't let you pull down the notifications bar. It's a security feature, so people can't bypass your lockscreen. All the best.

title: Looks promising!
comment: The lockscreen looks great and unlocks faster than other's I've tried. However on HTC One, double tapping the home button (or holding for Google Now) bypasses the lock and gives access to the phone. If that issue is resolved, this will definitely be my full time lockscreen!
Hi Matt! Thank you for your review. The Google Now vulnerability and other major bugs were fixed in the 1.1 version update which will be published tonight. All the best.

title: Great for beta
comment: Works, easy to install and setup, doesn't interfere with launcher (I use Nova on my Note 3). Still some issues that would be easy to iron out. It's slow which is annoying waiting for the screen to come up. Sometimes it relocks right after unlock and freezes my phone for a minute. Needs customization options for wallpaper and seeing unread messages. The lock sounds need a disable option. When I lock my phone by pressing the standby button, the scan NFC screen turns back on after 30sec and stays on.

Hi Kory! Thank you for your review. The slow bit is only when you first start the lockscreen since the background service needs a few seconds to fully launch. The unlock sounds are made by the Android NFC service, not the app.

Some major bugs and issues were resolved in the version 1.1 update which will be published tonight. All the best.

title: Brilliant
comment: A very good application that works perfectly

title: You really need to fix the camera issue
comment: If Tapunlock is enabled, it makes the camera unusable. Also, other NFC Apps seem to be better at recognizing the NFC Tag, especially if you have a stack of them (e.g. in your wallet). This would be a nice addon.

Thank you for your review! We will fix the camera bug on the next beta version coming out in a few days. We use the same NFC Tag recognition method as any other app on the market. The speed and accuracy of tag recognition depends on the type of tag, the tag swiping speed, the phone, the location of the NFC antenna etc.

title: Can't use camera
comment: Works great other then not being able to use camera.
Thank you for your review David! We will fix that in the next version.

title: Good but camera not worked
comment: Very good, work on Xperia z1 with galaring. PLEASE remove camera settings from administrator because can't make photos or video, when I open camera.  Error  some reason from security settings it's stop by administration . Please rezolve this and will be brilliant app.:-)
Thank you for the review Adrian! We will resolve that in the next version.

title: Does what it says on the tin!
Does What it Says on the Tin
comment: A bit clunky looking but works well on Note3. However, would be much more useful if it had Trigger app integration or some means to activate only when leaving home or office since I'm only worried about losing the phone in transit and swiping a tag becomes a major nuisance on a regular basis.
Hi Gabe! Thank you for the review. We will take your tips into consideration. A design improvement and a quick lock screen activate/deactivate will be introduced in the next beta version.

title: great app, so easy to use
Great app
comment: Excellent app design.

title: Does as planned.
comment: More please
